name: graph
description: Interactive force-directed graph showing connections between pages

activation.description: Add 'graph' to the visualizers list in sites/*.yaml to enable globally. Override per-page in frontmatter (graph: {depth: 3}) or position inline with a ```graph code fence containing YAML settings.

only_if_linked.description: Hide the graph if the current page has no connections in graph.json

depth.description: How many hops from the current page to include in the local graph

show_full_graph.description: Show a button that opens a modal with the full graph of all pages

colors.description: Override graph colors. Inherits from site CSS variables by default. Example: { node: '#ff6b6b', link: '#ddd', text: '#444', bg: '#fff' }

notes.positioning: TODO: a 'position' setting (values: bottom | right | left) is planned but not yet implemented. Right/left sidebar layout requires theme-level CSS grid changes. Currently the graph always renders at the bottom of the page (via the layout template) or at the ```graph code fence location if used inline.
notes.cdn: Renders using force-graph (MIT, vasturiano/force-graph) loaded from jsDelivr CDN at runtime. No npm install needed.
